documentation.description: Computes a discordance relation per criteria.
documentation.reference: Cailloux, Olivier. Electre and Promethee MCDA methods as reusable software components. In Proceedings of the 25th Mini-EURO Conference on Uncertainty and Robustness in Planning and Decision Making (URPDM 2010). Coimbra, Portugal, 2010.

documentation.description: The alternatives to consider. Set some alternatives as inactive (or remove them) to ignore them.
The criteria to consider, possibly with preference and veto thresholds. Each one must have a preference direction. Set some criteria as inactive (or remove them) to ignore them.
The performances of the alternatives on the criteria to consider.
The discordances relations (one relation per criterion) computed from the given input data.
